intro: Calceolaria corymbosa var. perennis, commonly known as the everlasting calceolaria, is a perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, hood-shaped flowers that resemble small cups. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
